question.question-text: It is NOT indicated in paragraph 1 that young William was working

answer-list.answer-text: in Chicago
for his father
as a soap salesman
in his father's factory

question.question-text: According to paragraph 1, it is NOT true that the soap that young Wrigley was selling

answer-list.answer-text: was originally well-liked
was originally priced at five cents
originally provided little profit for merchants
eventually became more popular with merchants

question.question-text: According to paragraph 2, it is NOT true that, when Wrigley first founded his own company, he was

answer-list.answer-text: selling soap
selling chewing gum
giving away cookbooks
using baking soda as a premium

question.question-text: It is NOT mentioned in paragraph 2 that Wrigley later

answer-list.answer-text: sold baking soda
used chewing gum as a premium to sell baking soda
sold chewing gum
used baking soda as a premium to sell chewing gum

question.question-text: According to paragraph 3, the Wm. Wrigley Jr. Company did all of the following EXCEPT

answer-list.answer-text: begin with two brands of gum
add new brands to the original two
phase out the last two brands
phase out the first two brands
